intro: Odontostemma filipes, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. Its stems are covered in fine hairs, and it is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation. Odontostemma filipes is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
